data.py¶

class data.Data(path)¶

An instance of this class stores the data used for learning and prediction. The stored information includes:

  • labeled data
  • unlabeled data (if uploaded)
  • labeled file name
  • unlabeled file name (if uploaded)
  • number of samples in labeled data
  • number of samples in unlabeled data (if uploaded)
  • number of features
  • type of features (individual and overall)
  • number of valid classes
  • number of samples per class
  • encoded data (integer and one-hot encoding)
Variables:
  • labeled_data (pandas dataframe) – labeled data for learning classifiers
  • unlabeled_data (pandas dataframe) – unlabeled data for prediction
  • labeled_name (str) – name of the labeled dataset
  • unlabeled_name (str) – name of the unlabeled dataset
  • labeled_num_samples (int) – number of samples in the labeled dataset
  • unlabeled_num_samples (int) – number of samples in the unlabeled dataset
  • num_features_ (int) – number of features
  • individual_feature_type (dict) – type of each feature in a dictionary whose keys are feature names
  • global_feature_type (str) – an overall summary of feature types (‘continuous’, ‘discrete’, ‘mixed’)
  • num_classes_ (int) – number of valid classes
  • class_num_samples (dict) – number of samples per class in a dictionary whose keys are class names
  • integer_encoded_labeled_data (pandas dataframe) – integer-encoded labeled data
  • integer_encoded_unlabeled_data (pandas dataframe) – integer-encoded unlabeled data
  • one_hot_encoded_labeled_data (pandas dataframe) – one-hot-encoded labeled data
  • one_hot_encoded_unlabeled_data (pandas dataframe) – one-hot-encoded unlabeled data
  • num_one_hot_encoded_features (int) – number of features after one-hot encoding
__init__(path)¶

Constructs a new instance of the class.

Parameters:path (str) – file path of the labeled data
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

add_unlabeled_data(path)¶

Adds unlabeled data for prediction.

Parameters:path (str) – file path of the unlabeled data
encode()¶

Encodes the data using integer and one-hot encoders.

feature_type(option='global')¶

Returns summary of feature types.

  • option=’individual’: type of each feature
  • option=’global’: overall summary of feature types
Parameters:option (str) – ‘individual’ or ‘global’
Returns:summary of feature types
name(option='labeled')¶

Returns name of the dataset.

  • option=’labeled’: name of labeled data
  • option=’unlabeled’: name of unlabeled data
Parameters:option (str) – ‘labeled’ or ‘unlabeled’
Returns:name of the dataset
num_classes()¶

Returns number of valid classes.

Returns:number of valid classes
num_features(option='raw')¶

Returns number of features.

  • option=’raw’: number of raw features (raw and integer-encoded data)
  • option=’one-hot’: number of features after one-hot encoding
Parameters:option (str) – ‘raw’,’integer’ or ‘one-hot’
Returns:number of features
num_samples(option='labeled')¶

Returns number of samples.

  • option=’labeled’: total number of samples in labeled data
  • option=’unlabeled’: total number of samples in unlabeled data
  • option=’classwise’: number of samples that belong to each class
Parameters:option (str) – ‘labeled’, ‘unlabeled’ or ‘classwise’
Returns:number of samples
prediction(option)¶

Returns encoded unlabeled data for prediction.

  • option=’integer’: integer-encoded data
  • option=’one-hot’: one-hot-encoded data
Parameters:option (str) – ‘integer’ or ‘one-hot’
Returns:encoded unlabeled data
split(test_size, stratify)¶

Splits labeled data into training and test sets.

Parameters:
  • test_size (float) – percent of test data
  • stratify (bool) – draw samples according to class proportions or not
summary(view)¶

Displays a summary of the loaded data. This includes

  • number of samples (total and classwise)
  • number of features
  • feature types (individual and global)

The summary is organized in a tree structure.

Parameters:view (QTreeWidget) – the widget where the summary is displayed
test(option)¶

Returns encoded test data.

  • option=’integer’: integer-encoded data
  • option=’one-hot’: one-hot-encoded data
Parameters:option (str) – ‘integer’ or ‘one-hot’
Returns:encoded test data
train(option)¶

Returns encoded training data.

  • option=’integer’: integer-encoded data
  • option=’one-hot’: one-hot-encoded data
Parameters:option (str) – ‘integer’ or ‘one-hot’
Returns:encoded training data
